business.headline: Trade deal in limbo as US team's India visit deferred amid tariff warThe United States has been pressing India to open its agriculture and dairy sectors, but New Delhi has ruled out concessions, saying such moves would endanger small farmers and cattle rearers.

Real wallet-friendly shake-up: GST 2.0 to feel like 'Good and Simple Tax'The government is set to launch GST 2.0 with major rate cuts, making essentials cheaper and simplifying tax slabs. The overhaul promises lower prices, fewer complications, and a true 'Good and Simple Tax'.

What nobody tells you about buying motor insuranceWhile car sales are climbing, many buyers remain unaware about the finer points of motor insurance, a gap that can cost them money and create problems when making a claim.

Government proposes 5%, 18% GST slabs; tobacco at 40%, relief for farmers: SourcesThe government has proposed reducing GST to two slabs: 5% and 18% with sin goods at 40%, aiming to cut taxes on essentials like farm products, health items, handicrafts, and insurance.

Credit ratings decoded: How a simple upgrade can change a country's fortuneGlobal credit rating agency S&P Global has upgraded India's long-term unsolicited sovereign credit rating to 'BBB' from 'BBB-'.

GST council meeting in September, 12% slam may be dropped: SourcesTwo-day GST Council meetings are expected in September to pave the way for reforms. The announcement was made by the Prime Minister from the ramparts of the Red Fort. These reforms are seen as a Diwali gift for the middle class. Key changes include the removal of the 12% GST slab and rate rationalisation for health and life insurance policies. The government aims to reduce the GST on most items currently in the 12% slab to 5%. This move is expected to make essential items such as footwear, bags, clothes, and toothpastes more affordable. The government is addressing concerns about inflation and the rising cost of living. Feedback regarding health insurance, which impacts the common person, has also been considered. The meetings in September are crucial for approving these changes, with implementation anticipated before Diwali. The Finance Ministry and state finance ministers have been involved in the process.

GST Council may drop 12% slab, more tax reforms in September meeting: SourcesThe meeting comes after Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in his Independence Day speech, announced plans for a major overhaul of the Goods and Services Tax (GST) system.

Claiming bias, same-sex couple approaches court over uneven tax: ReportThe petition was admitted by a bench of Justice BP Colabawalla and Justice Firdoush Pooniwalla, which has also issued a notice to the Attorney General as the case raises a constitutional question.

PM Modi announces next-generation GST reform with significantly lower ratesDuring his Independence Day address, Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced a sweeping overhaul of the GST system, promising to unveil a "next-generation" tax regime with substantially lower rates this Diwali, which he hailed as a festive gift from the Centre.

Rs 15,000 from government on 1st private-sector job: PM's big youth schemePM Modi in his Independence Day speech said that the Pradhan Mantri Viksit Bharat Rojgar Yojana will create nearly 3.5 crore new employment opportunities for the youth.

GST cut coming soon? What to expect after PM Modi's big Diwali promisePrime Minister Narendra Modi's announcement has set expectations for a substantial overhaul of the current multi-slab GST structure, which has been in place since 2017.

India to roll out its own semiconductor chips by end of 2025: PM ModiSpeaking on the country's 79th Independence Day, PM Modi hoisted the national flag for the 12th consecutive time before outlining the government's plans for technology, energy, and economic reforms.

entertainment.headline: Janhvi Kapoor mobbed during Dahi Handi event in Mumbai, actor maintains calmJanhvi Kapoor encountered a crowd surge while promoting 'Param Sundari' at a Mumbai Dahi Handi event amidst Janmashtami celebrations. Videos from the event were shared online.

Shah Rukh Khan shuts down troll asking him to retire with witty replyShah Rukh Khan engaged fans on X with a lively #AskSRK session, where he schooled a troll suggesting retirement. During the session on Saturday, he also updated fans about his recovery, 'King', and son Aryan's directorial debut.

2025: A year that documented the fall of greats in Tamil cinemaMani Ratnam, Shankar, Kamal Haasan, Suriya, and AR Murugadoss's films were criticised for their creations in 2025. This raises a pertinent question about the audience's changing tastes.

SRK talks about son Aryan's directorial debut Bads of Bollywood, confirms cameoShah Rukh Khan praised his son Aryan Khan's directorial debut 'B**ds of Bollywood' during his #AskSRK session, calling it very entertaining, wacky and emotional. The first look of the series will be unveiled on August 17.

Love speaks the loudest: Kiara Advani expresses gratitude to fans after War 2 successAyan Mukerji's 'War 2', starring Hrithik Roshan, Kiara Advani and Jr NTR, crossed Rs 100 crore at the box office within two days of release. The cast, including Kiara, Hrithik and Jr NTR, shared heartfelt messages thanking fans for their love and support.

Sunny Deol says playing Hanuman in Nitesh Tiwari's Ramayana is a big challengeSunny Deol, set to play Lord Hanuman in Nitesh Tiwari's 'Ramayana', shared that the role is both exciting and challenging. He also expressed hope that the film's scale and effects will match Hollywood standards and satisfy audiences.

To our lion: Kareena's roar of love for husband Saif Ali Khan on his 55th birthdaySaif Ali Khan celebrated his 55th birthday on August 16. Heartfelt wishes from family, especially his wife Kareena Kapoor Khan and sisters Soha and Saba, poured in via Instagram.

Malaika Arora on co-parenting son Arhaan with ex Arbaaz: We have our boundariesMalaika Arora opened up about her divorce with Arbaaz Khan, saying co-parenting has its challenges but they have managed to maintain balance for their son Arhaan.

Vivek Agnihotri cries dictatorship as Kolkata blocks The Bengal Files trailer launchFilmmaker Vivek Agnihotri faced significant hurdles during the trailer launch of his film 'The Bengal Files' in Kolkata. Despite the challenges and cancellations, the trailer was eventually unveiled, highlighting the film's exploration of West Bengal's turbulent political history and communal violence.

Anupam Kher attends Independence Day ceremony at Rashtrapati BhavanAnupam Kher attended the Independence Day At Home ceremony at Rashtrapati Bhavan, hosted by President Droupadi Murmu. The actor said he felt honoured and blessed to be part of the event.

Javed Akhtar claps back after troll suggests he celebrate Pak Independence DayOn Independence Day, Javed Akhtar shared a message remembering freedom fighters but was trolled online. He gave a sharp reply, reminding that his ancestors went to Kaala Pani for India's freedom while some others supported the British.

Geetha Govindam turns 7: Vijay Deverakonda, Rashmika share BTS pics, special postsVijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna celebrated seven years of their hit film 'Geetha Govindam' by sharing heartfelt notes on social media. While Vijay called the film "special" and said he is "missing" the team, Rashmika posted throwback pictures and said the film will "always be the most special."

Jitendra Kumar, Ravi Kishan to join Mirzapur The Film, shooting begins soon: ReportActors Jitendra Kumar and Ravi Kishan are reported to have joined the cast of the upcoming Mirzapur film, though an official confirmation is still awaited. The big-screen adaptation will also see Ali Fazal, Pankaj Tripathi, Divyenndu and Shweta Tripathi return, with shooting expected to begin soon.

IFFM 2025: Aamir Khan honoured, Neeraj Ghaywan's Homebound sweeps big awardsThe Indian Film Festival of Melbourne 2025 honoured Aamir Khan, Abhishek Bachchan, Jaideep Ahlawat, Arvind Swamy, and others for their contributions to cinema. Meanwhile, director Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound' bagged top honours.

Big B is the happiest father on Earth as son Abhishek Bachchan wins big at IFFM 2025Amitabh Bachchan wrote a heartfelt note after Abhishek Bachchan won Best Actor at the Indian Film Festival of Melbourne 2025, calling him "the pride of the family." The proud father said Abhishek's hard work and never-give-up attitude have finally brought him the respect he deserves.

War 2 box office Day 2: Hrithik, Jr NTR film soars past Coolie on Independence Day'War 2' has made a powerful impact at the box office, crossing Rs 100 crore in just two days despite mixed reviews. The Hindi version thrived on the Independence Day holiday, setting the stage for a fierce competition with Coolie as audiences across India flock to theatres.

When did Rajinikanth become God? Chasing the man, the myth, the legendFrom bus conductor to cinema deity, Rajinikanth is beyond a superstar; he is a phenomenon. For millions, his films are festivals, his words are scripture, and his very presence radiates the energy of a living legend. Fifty years on, the question isn't how he became a star, but how he became God.

Coolie box office Day 2: Rajinikanth reigns supreme with Rs 119 crore in IndiaRajinikanth's latest film 'Coolie' sets new records, becoming the first Tamil film to earn Rs 100 crore in two days, and breaking records overseas.

Priyanka Chopra's New York celebrations blend family milestones, Independence DayPriyanka Chopra marked a series of family celebrations and extended her best wishes for India's Independence Day. Alongwith a bunch of lively photos, the celebrated star wrote a thoughtful and lengthy note.

general news.headline: Over 2 dozen bullets fired at Elvish Yadav's Gurugram home, attackers on the runElvish Yadav was not present at his residence when the firing took place. Bullets riddled the lower floors of the multi-storey house while the controversial YouTuber's family and caretaker remained inside.

Days after Kishtwar, cloudburst kills 4 in J&K's Kathua, houses buriedSeveral houses were buried under rubble and floodwaters in the Ghati area, officials said. Damage was also reported on the Jammu–Pathankot National Highway. Rescue teams are at the spot.

Trade deal in limbo as US team's India visit deferred amid tariff warThe United States has been pressing India to open its agriculture and dairy sectors, but New Delhi has ruled out concessions, saying such moves would endanger small farmers and cattle rearers.

Yes, stray dogs can be trained. Canine whisperers reveal howThe debate over Delhi's stray dogs has split the nation. While pet dogs are trained and groomed, street dogs have an entirely different image. Unlike what is popularly believed, strays can be trained, and their aggression largely reduced. Behaviourists and trainers who have trained stray dogs tell us how.

How relevant is vinyl in the times of Spotify? Hint: VeryVinyl sales are surging, and it's not just retro culture or nostalgia driving the boom. So why are young music lovers, raised on streaming apps and voice assistants, falling for this analog medium?

Trump to press Zelenskyy to cede key region to Russia at White House meet: ReportTrump's desire for Ukraine to give up its remaining territory in this key eastern region to end the war could remain elusive. Ahead of the Alaska meeting, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy firmly dismissed such a possibility, saying it would only pave the way for future war.

Delhi gets Rs 11,000 crore road push as PM to inaugurate 2 highway projects todayThe 10.1-km Delhi section of the Dwarka Expressway and a key stretch of UER-II, built at a combined cost of nearly Rs 11,000 crore, aim to ease traffic congestion and improve the capital's connectivity.

Angry locals in cloudburst-hit Chasoti confront Omar Abdullah, demand faster rescueThe chief minister, who travelled by road to the disaster-hit area, the last motorable point en route to the Machail Mata shrine, was confronted by angry locals demanding faster rescue operations and answers about their missing family members.

Video: Shubhanshu Shukla, 2nd Indian in space, receives grand welcome in DelhiAstronaut Shubhanshu Shukla landed in Delhi in the early hours of Sunday and was received by Union Minister Jitendra Singh, Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta, and senior officials from ISRO.

BJP leader kills wife at girlfriend's behest in Rajasthan's Ajmer, both arrestedBJP leader Rohit Saini murdered his wife Sanju in Ajmer on August 10, staging it as a robbery at the insistence of his girlfriend Ritu Saini. Police arrested both within 24 hours after exposing the conspiracy.

Talks with Trump in Alaska sincere, bring us closer to necessary decisions: PutinPutin told senior Kremlin officials that his visit to Alaska was "timely and extremely useful," noting that Russia "have not had direct negotiations of this kind at this level for a long time."

Inside Odisha's ambitious dream of turning into a sporting powerhouseIf India indeed hosts the 2036 Olympics, Odisha will form the backbone of that dream. Here's why other states should take note of the state's ambitious sporting model.
SUV driver runs over Jaipur man after collision, road rage caught on CCTVA jeep driver ran over a man in an act of aggression following a dispute over a car collision in Jaipur.

Trump's tariffs put Tamil Nadu's 20,000 factories, 30 lakh jobs at riskIndia's knitwear hub Tiruppur faces a major crisis after Trump's steep US tariffs threaten 20,000 factories and 30 lakh jobs, prompting CM Stalin to seek PM Modi's urgent intervention.

Teen among 2 dead in Dahi Handi celebrations in Maharashtra, over 200 injuredOver 200 people were injured in Mumbai and Thane during 'Dahi Handi' celebrations on Saturday, which is being observed across Maharashtra on Janmasthami to mark the birth of Lord Krishna.

Why should we hire you? Bill Gates shares perfect answers for job interviewsBill Gates once role-played as a college dropout applying for his first job. His witty, practical answers with Stephen Curry reveal timeless lessons for job-seekers facing tough interview questions.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Samajwadi MLA, sacked for Yogi Adityanath praise, meets UP Chief MinisterPooja Pal, who was expelled from the Samajwadi Party, met Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath. Her expulsion has stirred political controversy.
Mahindra Vision S concept: Is this a new Scorpio?The Vision S SUV will be underpinned by the new NU_IQ platform, production slated for 2027.

Trump admin tightens scrutiny of 'good moral character' for US citizenshipThe new policy requires officers to conduct a "holistic assessment" that goes beyond checking criminal records. According to the memo, the determination "must involve more than a cursory mechanical review focused on the absence of wrongdoing."

Rahul Gandhi's 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' in Bihar to begin todayLeader of the Opposition Rahul Gandhi is set to begin his 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' in Bihar today. The Yatra will begin from Sasaram and culminate in Patna within 16 days.

IndiGo plane tail touches runway during Mumbai touchdown, pilots derosteredAn IndiGo Airbus A321's tail touched the runway at Mumbai airport during a go-around amid bad weather on August 16, 2025. The aircraft landed safely on a second attempt, with IndiGo confirming standard checks and safety measures.

sports.headline: 2 controversial goals: Barcelona begin season with bizarre win vs MallorcaBarcelona began their LaLiga season with a controversial win over Mallorca, in a match that featured two red cards and two goals that arguably should have been disallowed.

Manchester City's squad size has to reduce: Guardiola downplays win at WolvesManchester City opened their Premier League campaign with a resounding 4-0 win over Wolverhampton Wanderers at Molineux, but manager Pep Guardiola warned against reading too much into the result and highlighted concerns over the size of his squad.

Premier League: Chelsea's young core faces the ultimate test in the 2025-26 campaignChelsea head into the 2025-26 Premier League season chasing stability and ambition. After lifting two trophies last year, Enzo Maresca's side will rely on a young core, fresh signings, and squad continuity to mount a serious challenge at the top.

Manchester United vs Arsenal, Premier League: Predicted XIs, live-streamingOld Trafford will stage the Premier League's first blockbuster of the season on August 17, as Manchester United take on Arsenal. With new strikers Benjamin Sesko and Viktor Gyokeres in the spotlight, both sides will be eager to make a statement in what promises to be an early-season epic.

Inside Odisha's ambitious dream of turning into a sporting powerhouseIf India indeed hosts the 2036 Olympics, Odisha will form the backbone of that dream. Here's why other states should take note of the state's ambitious sporting model.

After CSK issue Brevis signing clarification, Ashwin clears air on remarkR Ashwin has clarified the remark he made about Dewald Brevis signing with CSK, saying that his comments were taken out of context. CSK issued a statement about the Brevis signing on August 16 to put rumours about the authenticity of the move to bed.

Dewald Brevis breaks Virat Kohli's major record after breathtaking 50 vs AustraliaSouth Africa batter Dewald Brevis broke Virat Kohli's five-year-old record in Australia after his phenomenal show in the three-matchT20I series against Australia.

Eddie Howe eyes swift resolution on Alexander Isak after Villa stalemateEddie Howe has urged Newcastle to resolve Alexander Isak's future quickly after the striker missed their 0-0 draw with Aston Villa. The manager insists the door is open for Isak, but stressed the club needs clarity to avoid distractions this season.

BCCI introduces injury replacement rule in domestic cricket, will ICC follow suit?The BCCI has introduced a revolutionary injury replacement rule for multi-day tournaments in the upcoming domestic season. The law is set to make its debut in the Duleep Trophy from August 28 and the Under-19 CK Nayudu Trophy.

Julius Yego ends Diamond League drought, Duplantis wins in Silesia without recordVeteran javelin thrower Julius Yego ended a nine-year wait by winning the men's javelin at the Silesia Diamond League in Poland. Mondo Duplantis, who set the pole vault world record for the 13th time last week, fell short of another record but still finished on top on Saturday.

ISL clubs warn AIFF of possible shutdown if ongoing impasse is not resolvedEleven ISL clubs have warned the AIFF they may shut down if the deadlock over the league's future continues, putting the 2025-26 season, thousands of jobs, and India's international football standing at serious risk.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
